    <item> 
      <title>Blogger reveals parking ticket errors</title>  
      <description>A blogger in New York uses public data to prove that the New York Police Department ticketed thousands of cars that were actually parked legally.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/technology-36275930#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/technology-36275930</guid>  
      <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 14:20:26 GMT</pubDate> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>Apple invests in Chinese Uber rival</title>  
      <description>Apple invests $1bn (Â£693m) in Didi Chuxing, the car-hailing app that has a bigger market share than Uber in China.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-36283661#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>

    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>Is technology becoming less disruptive?</title>  
      <description>New York's Tech Crunch Disrupt seemed a little short of groundbreaking, but that doesn't mean the industry is stagnating.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/technology-36280481#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>

    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>Fetish forum traceable data 'stolen'</title>  
      <description>A hardcore fetish forum has been hacked, exposing more than 100,000 user account details, according to a prominent security researcher.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/technology-36275547#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/technology-36275547</guid>

      <media:thumbnail width="144" height="81" url="http://c.files.bbci.co.uk/113E3/production/_89672607_mansad.gif"/> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>Photoshop gets 'Shazam for fonts' tool</title>  
      <description>An artificial-intelligence-powered tool that identifies fonts is being added to the mobile and desktop versions of Photoshop.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/technology-36276671#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>

    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>India to require licence for map apps</title>  
      <description>India is introducing legislation to ban any maps or satellite images of the country unless they are approved by government.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/technology-36276754#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/technology-36276754</guid>

    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>YouTube defended in row over royalties</title>  
      <description>Prominent online video star Hank Green defends YouTube in a row over the way the site treats musicians.</description>

    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>Statins alert over computer glitch</title>  
      <description>Thousands of NHS patients in England may have been incorrectly prescribed statins due to a computer glitch.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-36274791#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>

    <item> 
      <title>US Congress 'bans members' Yahoo Mail'</title>  
      <description>A series of ransomware attacks on the House of Representatives leads US Congress to ban members from using Yahoo Mail, according to a leaked email.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/technology-36275537#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/technology-36275537</guid>  
      <pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 11:17:57 GMT</pubDate> 
    </item>  
    <item> 
      <title>Early test shows off Hyperloop system</title>  
      <description>An early test of Hyperloop - a proposed high-speed transport system - accelerates a sled to 116 mph (187km/h) in 1.1 seconds.</description>  
      <link>http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-36273151#sa-ns_mchannel=rss&ns_source=PublicRSS20-sa</link>  
      <guid isPermaLink="false">http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-36273151</guid>

    </item>

      <title>Woman 'filmed suicide on Periscope'</title>  
      <description>An investigation opens into the death of a 19-year-old woman in France who reportedly live-streamed her own suicide.</description>
